# setDelegate(_:queue:)

**Instance Method**

Assigns a delegate to receive real-time timecode updates and specifies a queue for callbacks.

## Declaration

```swift
func setDelegate(_ delegate: (any AVCaptureTimecodeGeneratorDelegate)?, queue callbackQueue: dispatch_queue_t?)
```

## Parameters

- **delegate**: An object conforming to the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureTimecodeGeneratorDelegate] protocol.
- **callbackQueue**: The dispatch queue on which the delegate methods are invoked. The `callbackQueue` parameter may not be `nil`, except when setting the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureTimecodeGeneratorDelegate] to `nil`, otherwise [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureTimecodeGenerator/setDelegate(_:queue:)] throws an `NSInvalidArgumentException`.

## Discussion

Use this method to configure a delegate that handles timecode updates. The specified `queue` ensures thread-safe invocation of delegate methods.

## Configuring the generator

- **synchronizationTimeout**: The maximum time interval allowed for source synchronization attempts before timing out.
- **timecodeAlignmentOffset**: The time offset, in seconds, applied to the generated timecode.
- **timecodeFrameDuration**: The frame duration that the generator will use to generate timecodes.
